title: Analysis of Career Decision Factors for Graduate Students in Instructional Design: Application of Mixed Research Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Mastery of foundational instructional design theory and practical experience
context.additional_context: Establishing data-driven analysis and strategies to strengthen career decision-making support for in-service professionals.

learning_goals: Three or more career decision-making barriers among graduate students in instructional design can be identified using a mixed-methods research approach
Learner-tailored career support strategies can be designed based on social cognitive career theory
Career decision-making difficulty can be assessed in three levels (lack of preparation, lack of information, information mismatch) using the CDDQ tool
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
